title: Piz Julier
text:
Piz Julier (German, ) is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> of the <a href="Albula%20Alps">Albula Alps</a>, overlooking the <a href="Julier%20Pass">Julier Pass</a>, in the Swiss canton of <a href="Graub%C3%BCnden">Graubünden</a>. With a height of 3,380 metres above sea level, Piz Julier is the second highest peak (after <a href="Piz%20Calderas">Piz Calderas</a>) of the group between the Julier Pass and the <a href="Albula%20Pass">Albula Pass</a>.
Piz Julier can be summited by experienced hikers. From the heights of <a href="St.%20Moritz">St. Moritz</a>, a trail leads to Fuorcla Albana (2,870 metres), the pass between Piz Julier and <a href="Piz%20Albana">Piz Albana</a>. From there a via ferrata, named "Senda Enferrada" leads to the summit.
